intro: Hieracium reclinatum, commonly known as the drooping hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium reclinatum is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich environments.
